intro: Saurauia omichlophila, commonly known as the velvetleaf stonecrop, is a rare and specialized plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to its arid or semi-arid habitat. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in shaded or partially shaded environments. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have a pink or reddish hue. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Saurauia omichlophila is considered a vulnerable species.
